article_title: DC Circ. Loath To Let W.Va. Sue Feds Over ACA Rule Fix
article_text:
DC Circ. Loath To Let W.Va. Sue Feds Over ACA Rule Fix

Law360, Washington (April 15, 2016, 8:24 PM ET) -- A D.C. Circuit panel appeared reluctant Friday to let West Virginia sue the Obama administration over its insurance transition fix to the Affordable Care Act, criticizing arguments that any injury from the conferred responsibility of determining grace periods for phasing out non-ACA compliant plans could be remedied in the courts.



U.S. Circuit Judge Laurence Silberman grilled counsel for the state on how it has satisfied the Constitution’s redressability test to justify Article III standing, if all it is seeking is a declaratory judgment that the federal...
